results.title: Round the world by air
results.brief_description: A film record of the delivery flight of the first Convair Aircraft purchased by Trans-Australia Airlines. The aircraft travelled 18,000 miles in 72 hours on its round-the-world trip, passing over 25 countries on its flight from San Diego, USA, to Melbourne. Photography by Geoffrey Thompson.

results.title: Round the twist Series 3 - Volume 5 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Bernadette O'Mahony, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Mali Boo”, Tony discovers an old Malibu surfboard in the garage, and Pete is keen to make a splash at the Port Niranda surf carnival, that is until the board’s real owner shows up. In “Brainless”, Bronson teams up with resident geek Anthony for a science project that ends up with Pete and Linda having their brains sucked out their noses. While Bronson is searching for their brains at the local tip, Linda and Pete’s bodies become Gribbles’ personal slaves. In “Toy Love”, Linda’s old Veronique doll comes back to haunt her, refusing to leave her alone, and neither will Gribble who has heard Linda read from the Viking Book of Love. In “The Tears Of Innocence”, Port Niranda is in the middle of a drought when days before the annual flower show, Derek the rainmaker arrives. In “The Ice Cream Man Cometh”, Linda is sacked from Mr. Gribble’s ice cream parlor, so she finds work with Paulo the master ice cream maker. In “If The Walls Could Talk”, Bronson feels left out because no-one ever tells him anything, thinking he is too young. If only the walls could talk he sighs, and then they begin to - the challenge is to make them be quiet again. In “The Big Rock”, Gribbles gets his hands on the Viking Book of Love and reads the final poem, accidentally unleashing a curse which turns Faye into a frog. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Bernadette O’Mahony, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist Series 3 - Volume 4 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Bernadette O'Mahony, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “The Big Burp”, Pete finally meets the girl of his dreams. He can’t believe his luck - Jeannie is the most beautiful girl in Port Niranda - even if she is a tree spirit. Pete is also very surprised to find that he has somehow fallen pregnant. In “The Viking Book of Love”, a long boat of ancient Vikings, led by chef Snorri, emerges from an eerie fog which is enveloping Port Niranda, however the real trouble begins when the chief’s son, Snorrisen, falls in love with Linda after he reads to her from the Viking Book of Love. “The Whirling Derfish” sees Bronson swallow a rare whirling derfish, causing his willy to spin like a propellor turning him into a human outboard motor known as “The Port Niranda Porpoise”. In “Umi”, Pete’s mind is trapped in Gribble’s body and vice versa, due to a particularly realistic video game they played. While Pete is spending a nasty night with Matron Gribble, Gribble is trying to convince Tony to sell the lighthouse. In “Truth Hits Everybody”, Linda loses out to Gribble as the host of the Port Niranda High School Broadcast, so she decides to do her own show. Anthony, Fiona, Pete and Linda find a magic microphone that makes everyone speak the truth, which is not always a good thing. In “Niranderthal Boy”, the tradition in the Twist household of the razor being passed on from father to elder son is broken when Bronson uses it before Pete - thus chaos is unleashed and the consequences can only be dangerous. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Round the twist Series 2 - Volume 4
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Five more exciting episodes of life with the Twist family in their lighthouse home. 1.”Next Time Around” - Linda hypnotises Peter, so every time someone says “now”, Peter behaves like a chicken. Pete is soon in serious trouble when Linda can’t undo the hypnosis. 2.”Copy Cat” - Bronson finds an ancient Mongolian cat hat and Linda takes advantage of its magical qualities to win the Birdman competition. 3. “Little Squirt” - Bronson is the humiliated loser in the school peeing competition, but a magic water spirit helps him prove he is no “little squirt”. 4.”Pink Bow Tie” - When Peter, Gribble, Rabbit and Tiger witness an “age-rager” in use, the result does not impress their school principal. 5.”Nails” - When a new boy, who never removes his gloves, comes to school, Linda earns his trust and learns his secret. Based on the stories by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Round the twist Series 2 - Volume 3 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Adapted for television from his own stories by the highly popular Australian children’s author Paul Jennings, each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. “Sloppy Jalopy” - When Pete lands in the middle of a sea of polluted sludge from Mr Gribble’s waste disposal unit, even showers will not wash off the putrid smell. “Smelly Feet” - Bronson upsets Ms James by refusing to attend her birthday party, but the real reason has something to do with the fact that he has not taken his shoes off for 6 months. “Grandad’s Gifts” - When Linda hears a strange and terrible sound behind the wall, she is convinced it is connected to the lemon tree sprouting fruit, but only Nell knows the true reason. “Ice Maiden” - Besotted with Dad’s sculpture of Ice Maiden, Bronson resolves to save it from his red-haired cousin, Terry. “Yuckles” - Mr Gribble plans to build a casino on the site of a thousand year old rainforest, the home of the mysterious Yuckle - but Mr Gribble’s plans blow up in his face. “Quivering Heap” - Young Gribble tries to prevent Pete from playing Dracula in the school play. “Little Black Balls” - When a goat eats Nell’s valuable opal, Bronson is forced to collect and examine each of the goat’s droppings. “Seeing the Light” - On election night, everyone gathers at the lighthouse for a party, but the lighthouse ghosts have plans of their own.

results.title: Round the twist Series 1 & 2 - Volume 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Mark Lewis, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Adapted for television from his own stories by the highly popular Australian children’s author Paul Jennings, each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Know All” a trunk of old circus costumes and a scarecrow are combined with unexpected results. “The Copy” has the Twist children experimenting with cloning, while in “Without My Pants” Pete develops an embarrassing turn of phrase. In “Lighthouse Blues” the Twist family is threatened with eviction from the lighthouse, and in “Next Time Around” Pete gets into trouble after Linda hypnotises him. Bronson finds an ancient and magical Mongolian cap in “Copy Cat”, and is helped by a water spirit in “Little Squirt”. In “Pink Bow Tie” a bad hair day for Pete, Gribble, Rabbit and Tiger leads to trouble at school, and in “Nails” Linda befriends the mysterious new boy at school.

results.title: Round the twist Series 1 - Volume 1 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Mark Lewis, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Adapted for television from his own stories by the highly popular Australian children’s author Paul Jennings, each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. “Skelton on the Dunny” tells how the Twists deal with a haunted outside loo, while in “Birdsdo” rogue seagulls inadvertently help Linda and Pete prove that Nell is not insane. Pete meets a ghost who wants his help at the local tip in “A Good Tip for Ghosts”, and Bronson finds a baby in “The Cabbage Patch Fib”. In “Spaghetti Pig Out” the Twists find that, after being hit by lightning, their remote control works on people, with chaotic results. “The Gum Leaf War” takes Linda into the mountains where she encounters a strange and powerful tree. Wishes granted to the Twist family turn out not to be the boon that they seem in “Santa Claws”, while in “Wunderpants” Pete’s underwear has special powers. In “Lucky Lips” a magic lipstick makes Pete irresistible, and Dad wants to try his own luck.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Mark Lewis, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
results.description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Adapted for television from his own stories by the highly popular Australian children’s author Paul Jennings, each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. “Skelton on the Dunny” tells how the Twists deal with a haunted outside loo, while in “Birdsdo” rogue seagulls inadvertently help Linda and Pete prove that Nell is not insane. Pete meets a ghost who wants his help at the local tip in “A Good Tip for Ghosts”, and Bronson finds a baby in “The Cabbage Patch Fib”. In “Spaghetti Pig Out” the Twists find that, after being hit by lightning, their remote control works on people, with chaotic results. “The Gum Leaf War” takes Linda into the mountains where she encounters a strange and powerful tree. Wishes granted to the Twist family turn out not to be the boon that they seem in “Santa Claws”, while in “Wunderpants” Pete’s underwear has special powers. In “Lucky Lips” a magic lipstick makes Pete irresistible, and Dad wants to try his own luck.
